intro: Schizoglossum flavum var. lineare, commonly known as the linear-flowered schizoglossum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to drought conditions. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
